questions.text: Raskolnikov, a student who commits murder, is a character in a novel by what author?
The haunting quality of the victim's eye is a motive for murder in which short story by Poe?
questions.explanation:
The Tell-Tale Heart.

	All are works by Poe that involve murderous crimes

questions.text: 'Lord of the Flies' deals with the murderous impulses of what group?
This play by Arthur Miller deals with fatal criminal negligence by one of the characters
questions.explanation:
All My Sons.

	All are by Miller. 'Salesman' is the best {known;} 'Fall' deals with a Monroe-like person

questions.text: An accidental killing by an individual of limited intelligence is a key part of a novel by what author?
In Agatha Christie's short story, 'Witness for the Prosecution', who is the murderer?
questions.explanation:
The defendant.

	They said he did it - and he did!

questions.text: Which play by Eugene O'Neill involves the murder of a man by his wife?
questions.explanation:
Mourning Becomes Electra.

	Based on the Oedipus stories. all are by O'Neill - as is 'The 'Iceman Cometh', which also involves murder.

questions.text: In Oscar Wilde's 'Picture of Dorian Gray', whom does Dorian kill?
questions.correct: The artist who painted the picture
questions.explanation:
The artist who painted the picture.

	The innocent artist - who started it all

questions.text: Which author describes a social climbing young man whose murder of a woman is largely based on his quest for status and prestige?
questions.explanation:
Theodore Dreiser.

	'An American Tragedy'. Later, 'A Place in the Sun', with Monty Clift and Liz Taylor.

questions.text: The killing of Tybalt and Mercutio are key events in which one of Shakespeare's plays?
questions.explanation:
Romeo and Juliet.

	There is no shortage of murder in Shakespeare. Hamlet must avenge a murder, Othello commits one - as does Macbeth. Julius Caesar is murdered. Etc. etc. etc.
